prompt: Can you provide me with some text-to-speech voices or programs?

hidden_queries: text-to-speech voices or programs list best TTS software voices
text-to-speech programs with natural voices text to speech options
metadata.generated_search_query: text-to-speech voices or programs list best TTS software voices

sources.title: Best text-to-speech software of 2025
sources.snippet:
This document from TechRadar (dated September 29, 2025) presents a comprehensive guide to the best text-to-speech (TTS) software of 2025. It emphasizes the growing importance of TTS for accessibility, productivity, and content creation, particularly in media like YouTube and podcasting.

The top picks include:

1. **NaturalReader** – Best overall for personal/home use, offering 56 voices across 9 languages and cloud-based access.
2. **Murf** – Best for realistic AI voices, ideal for e-learning and presentations, with advanced editing and voice-changing tools.
3. **Amazon Polly** – Best for developers, offering easy API integration and broad language support.
4. **Play.ht** – Best for podcasting, providing nearly 600 voices in over 60 languages, with options tailored for commercial use.
5. **Voice Dream Reader** – Best for Mac and iOS users, offering 186 voices in 30 languages and compatibility with multiple cloud services.

The article also explains the difference between web-based TTS services and desktop software, discusses subscription models, and offers advice for integrating TTS into business workflows. Each software was rigorously tested based on performance, usability, voice quality, and pricing.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are reliable text-to-speech (TTS) programs and voice options you can use — free and paid — with a range of natural voices and features: Speechify+4TechRadar+4NaturalReader+4
Web & Online Tools NaturalReader – Online TTS with a library of natural AI voices (Gemini, ChatGPT voices). Good for reading docs, PDFs, web pages. NaturalReader
Speechify – AI voice generator with 1,000+ realistic voices in 60+ languages, works in browser or mobile. Speechify
Natural TTS Labs – Free online TTS with 150+ voices you can download; simple paste-and-convert. naturalttslabs.com
NaturalVoice.io – Free cloud TTS with natural voices and multiple languages. NaturalVoice
OpenTTS.ai – Browser-based TTS with both free basic voices (Web Speech API) and higher-quality GPT-4o mini voices. OpenTTS.AI
AI & Creative Voice Tools ElevenLabs – Highly realistic AI voices with custom voice options; good for voiceovers, narration, audiobooks. Fahim AI
Murf.ai – AI TTS focused on professional voiceovers with editable pacing/intonation; supports multiple voice styles. Geekflare
Lovo – Variety of expressive AI voices; often used for video narration and podcasts. Voice.ai
Synthesys – TTS + voiceover tool with natural voices and commercial usage options. Content Mavericks

citation_mappings.claim_text: Developer & API Options Amazon Polly – API TTS with broad language support, used in apps and services. TechRadar
Google Cloud Text-to-Speech – Developer API with many voices, styles, and SSML control. Software Testing Help
Azure Text to Speech – Microsoft’s cloud TTS with neural voices and customization. Software Testing Help
Simple / Desktop Utilities Balabolka – Free Windows TTS software with many voice engine options and MP3/WAV export. Voice.ai
Panopreter Basic – Basic free TTS for documents and text with audio file output. Voice.ai

sources.title: Claude's voice mode is now free for everyone - here's how to try it
sources.snippet:
Anthropic has introduced a free voice mode for its popular AI chatbot, Claude, accessible via its iOS and Android mobile apps. This new feature allows users to have spoken conversations with Claude, who responds audibly while also displaying key points on the screen. The voice mode supports five distinct voice styles—Buttery, Airy, Mellow, Glassy, and Rounded—and is currently available in English only.

Users can activate the feature by tapping the sound wave icon in the app and selecting their preferred voice. It is particularly useful in hands-free situations, such as commuting, cooking, or multitasking. To enhance the experience, it’s recommended to use the feature in quieter settings, speak naturally, and divide complex queries into smaller parts. Users can seamlessly switch between voice and text while maintaining conversation context. While similar to voice features in ChatGPT and Gemini Live, Claude’s voice mode stands out by being free for short sessions.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Voice Conversation Modes Claude voice mode – Free audible responses in the Claude AI app, multiple voice styles. Tom's Guide
